intro: Habenaria tsaratananensis, commonly known as the Tsaratanana orchid, is a rare and endemic species found primarily in Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, spurred flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. The plant grows as a terrestrial orchid, often in shaded, moist forest environments. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous root system and lanceolate leaves with a waxy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
